workflow.name: Automate release notes from ClickUp to Notion & Slack with GPT-4o
workflow.description:
## üìò Description:
This workflow automates the entire release note creation and announcement process whenever a task status changes in ClickUp.
Using Azure OpenAI GPT-4o, Notion, Slack, Gmail, and Google Sheets, it converts technical task data into clear, structured, and branded release notes ‚Äî ready for documentation and team broadcast.
The flow captures task details, generates Markdown-formatted FAQs, documents them in Notion, formats professional Slack messages, and notifies the task owner via HTML email.
Any failed payloads or validation errors are logged automatically to Google Sheets for full traceability.
The result is a zero-touch release workflow that saves time, keeps communication consistent, and ensures every completed feature is clearly documented and shared.

## ‚öôÔ∏è What This Workflow Does (Step-by-Step)

üü¢ ClickUp Task Status Trigger
 Listens for task status updates (e.g., In Review ‚Üí Complete) within the specified ClickUp team.
 Whenever a task reaches a completion state, this node starts the release note workflow automatically.

üîç Validate ClickUp Payload (IF Node)
 Checks that the incoming ClickUp webhook contains a valid task_id.
 ‚úÖ True Path: Proceeds to fetch task details.
 ‚ùå False Path: Logs the invalid payload to Google Sheets for review.

üìã Fetch Task Details from ClickUp
 Retrieves full information about the task using the task_id, including title, description, status, assignee, priority, and custom fields.
 Provides complete task context for AI processing.

üß© Parse Task Details in JavaScript
 Cleans and standardizes task data into JSON format with fields like title, description, priority, owner, due date, and task URL.
 Also extracts optional links (e.g., GitHub references).
 Ensures consistent, structured input for the AI model.

üß† Configure GPT-4o Model (Azure OpenAI)
 Initializes GPT-4o as the core reasoning engine for FAQ and release-note generation, ensuring context-aware and concise output.

ü§ñ Generate Release Notes FAQ (AI Agent)
 Transforms task details into a Markdown-formatted release note under four standardized sections:
 1Ô∏è‚É£ What changed
 2Ô∏è‚É£ Why
 3Ô∏è‚É£ How to use
 4Ô∏è‚É£ Known issues
 Each section is written clearly and briefly for internal and external readers.

üìò Save Release Notes to Notion
 Creates a new page in the Notion ‚ÄúRelease Notes‚Äù database.
 Includes task URL, owner, status, priority, and the full AI-generated FAQ content.
 Serves as the single source of truth for changelogs and release documentation.

üí¨ Configure GPT-4o Model (Slack Formatting)
 Prepares another GPT-4o model instance for formatting Slack-ready announcements in a professional and brand-consistent tone.

üé® Generate Slack Release Announcement (AI Agent)
 Converts the Notion release information into a polished Slack message.
 Adds emojis, bullet points, and a clickable task URL ‚Äî optimized for quick team consumption.

üì¢ Announce Release in Slack
 Posts the AI-formatted message directly to the internal Slack channel, notifying the team of the latest feature release.
 Keeps everyone aligned without manual drafting or posting.

üì® Send Acknowledgment Email to Assignee (Gmail Node)
 Sends an automated HTML email to the task owner confirming that their release is live.
 Includes task name, status, priority, release date, quick links to Notion and ClickUp, and a preview of the AI-generated FAQ.
 Delivers a professional confirmation while closing the communication loop.

üö® Log Errors in Google Sheets
 Captures all payload validation errors, API failures, or processing exceptions into an ‚ÄúError Log Sheet.‚Äù
 Ensures complete auditability and smooth maintenance of the workflow.

## üß© Prerequisites
- ClickUp API credentials (for task triggers & data fetch)
- Azure OpenAI (GPT-4o) credentials
- Notion API integration (for release documentation)
- Slack API connection (for announcements)
- Gmail API access (for acknowledgment emails)
- Google Sheets API access (for error logging)

## üí° Key Benefits
 ‚úÖ Converts completed tasks into professional release notes automatically
 ‚úÖ Publishes directly to Notion with consistent documentation
 ‚úÖ Broadcasts updates to Slack in clean, branded format
 ‚úÖ Notifies assignees instantly via personalized HTML email
 ‚úÖ Maintains transparent error tracking in Google Sheets

## üë• Perfect For
- Product & Engineering Teams managing frequent feature releases
- SaaS companies automating changelog and release documentation
- Project managers maintaining internal knowledge bases
- Teams using ClickUp, Notion, Slack, and Gmail for daily operations

parameters.content:
## ClickUp Trigger & Validation
Listens for ClickUp task status changes and validates the webhook payload.  
Prevents invalid or empty task events from being processed.

## How it works
This automation turns ClickUp task updates into complete release-note workflows.  
When a task‚Äôs status changes in ClickUp (e.g., ‚ÄúIn Review‚Äù ‚Üí ‚ÄúComplete‚Äù), the workflow fetches full task details, cleans them, and uses Azure OpenAI GPT-4o to generate structured, Markdown-style release notes.  
The notes are saved automatically in Notion under the ‚ÄúRelease Notes‚Äù database, then shared in Slack as a formatted announcement.  
Finally, an HTML email acknowledgment is sent to the task owner confirming that the release is documented and live.  
Any validation or API errors are logged in Google Sheets for traceability.

## Setup steps
1. Connect your credentials:  
   - ClickUp (webhook + API)  
   - Azure OpenAI API  
   - Notion (database)  
   - Slack  
   - Gmail  
   - Google Sheets (for error logging)
2. Replace Notion DB ID, Slack user/channel, and Google Sheet ID with yours.  
3. Confirm ClickUp team ID and event trigger (`taskStatusUpdated`).  
4. Adjust the Gmail HTML message if desired.  
5. Run a test task update to verify flow end-to-end.

options.systemMessage:
=You are a release notes editor. 
Your job is to turn technical task information into a clear, simple FAQ for users and internal teams. 
Be concise, non-marketing, and structured under these exact 4 sections:
1) What changed
2) Why
3) How to use
4) Known issues

Each section should be 2‚Äì4 short bullet points.

=You are a Slack message formatter for release announcements.

Your job is to take ClickUp task information and create a visually appealing, professional Slack message.

Requirements:
1. Use Slack markdown formatting (bold with *, italics with _, code blocks with ```)
2. Include appropriate emojis for visual appeal
3. Keep it concise and scannable
4. Structure: Header ‚Üí Key Details ‚Üí Task Link ‚Üí Release Date ‚Üí Footer
5. Use bullet points or clean formatting for readability
6. Add a clickable link to the ClickUp task
7. Include automation signature at the bottom

Return ONLY the formatted Slack message text, no JSON, no explanations

parameters.subject: =‚úÖ Release Ready: {{ $('Parse Task Details in JavaScript').item.json.title }}

parameters.content:
## Task Data Fetching & Parsing
Retrieves detailed ClickUp task info and converts it into clean JSON fields.  
Ensures consistent input for AI-based release-note generation.

## AI Release-Note Generation
Uses GPT-4o to summarize task details into a four-section FAQ format.  
Each section highlights what changed, why, how to use it, and any known issues.

## Notion Documentation & Record Keeping
Automatically creates a new Notion entry under ‚ÄúRelease Notes.‚Äù  
Captures all key fields: title, owner, priority, status, and generated FAQ.

## Slack Announcement & AI Formatting
Formats a professional, emoji-enhanced Slack message using GPT-4o.  
Posts it to the team channel to announce the new release instantly.

## Email Acknowledgment & Closure
Sends a confirmation email to the task assignee.  
Includes release details, links to Notion & ClickUp, and a preview of the AI-generated notes.

## Error Handling & Logging
Logs any missing payloads or API failures to Google Sheets.  
Provides visibility into workflow issues for easy debugging.

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
